oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lynchburg Historic District: Public Square commercial block
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of one part of commercial block with a concrete foundation, dichromatic brickwork, metal shed awning, flat roof, and stepped parapet. Lynchburg Pottery building, circa 1920, has wrap storefront windows and recessed entrance with half-glass doors and four light transom. Sundae's Restaurant and Ice Cream Shoppe, circa 1910, has a three bay facade with two plate glass storefront windows with wood frames, a recessed entrance with side storefront windows, and double half-glass doors with wood frame. The Silver Stop and Judy's Leather shops are part of the one part commercial block. The two buildings have a flat roof and concrete foundation. The building on the east was built circa 1910. The other was built circa 1920. The decorative dichromatic brickwork and transom windows have been painted over on this side of the commercial block.

The Lynchburg Historic District is comprised of eighty-two properties which make up the central part of the community, located in Moore County, TN. Lynchburg was designated as the county seat of the newly established Moore County in 1871. It is also the commercial and industrial center for the county. The area contains buildings that represent the development of Lynchburg from a crossroads community into the political and commercial center of Moore County. The integrity of the district is evident not only in the historic buildings, but in the layout of the town, which reflects the impact of the county seat designation. The focus of the historic district is a downtown core which surrounds the courthouse block and is known as the Public Square.
